title: Nigeria: At Least 27 Dead After Boat Capsizes In Niger River
content: A Nigerian river ferry capsized Friday killing at least 27 people and leaving many missing, officials told AFP of the latest in a series of mass drownings on the country's busy waterways.
summary: A Nigerian river ferry capsized Friday killing at least 27 people and leaving many missing, officials told AFP of the latest in a series of mass drownings on the country's busy waterways.

title: Explained: What's Happening in Syria, How It Could Affect Middle East
content: The civil war in Syria had thawed. But 13 years since the beginning of one of the worst humanitarian crises of the 21st century, a new surge in violence has reignited attention on a conflict that had faded from the world's headlines.
summary: The civil war in Syria had thawed. But 13 years since the beginning of one of the worst humanitarian crises of the 21st century, a new surge in violence has reignited attention on a conflict that had faded from the world's headlines.

title: US Approves $320 Billion F-16 Fighter Planes, Radar Systems To Taiwan
content: The United States on Friday said it had approved the possible sale of spare parts for F-16 fighter planes and radar systems to Taiwan, in a deal valued at $320 million.
summary: The United States on Friday said it had approved the possible sale of spare parts for F-16 fighter planes and radar systems to Taiwan, in a deal valued at $320 million.

title: Bangladesh Must Ensure Fair Trial For Hindu Monk: S Jaishankar

title: Harry and Meghan Leading 'Isolated' Life In US, Reveals Documentary Director
content: The documentary intends to examine whether the couple had achieved "freedom" and financial independence since stepping back from royal duties.
summary: The documentary intends to examine whether the couple had achieved "freedom" and financial independence since stepping back from royal duties.

title: Fact Check: Was Muhammad Yunus' Daughter Arrested For Drunk Driving?
content: Muhammad Yunus, the Nobel Laureate and chief adviser of the interim government of Bangladesh, has often been in the spotlight, not just for his achievements but also for his contentious relationship with the US president-elect Donald Trump.

title: 'Toxic' Odour At International Space Station Detected. What Happened Next?
content: Cosmonauts detected a strange odour emanating from a Russian spacecraft after it docked at the International Space Station (ISS) last weekend.
summary: Cosmonauts detected a strange odour emanating from a Russian spacecraft after it docked at the International Space Station (ISS) last weekend.

title: US Model, Family Ambushed By Gunmen At Brazil Restaurant, Held Hostage
content: A New York-based model, her husband and their 11-year-old child were abducted at gunpoint and held captive in a remote shack in Sao Paulo, Brazil, for 12 hours.
summary: A New York-based model, her husband and their 11-year-old child were abducted at gunpoint and held captive in a remote shack in Sao Paulo, Brazil, for 12 hours.

title: Sydney Woman Kills Husband With Drop Saw, Disposes Of Body In 30 Bags
content: Police allege she killed him on May 3 last year using knives and a power saw, and disposed of his body in plastic bags across several suburbs.
summary: Police allege she killed him on May 3 last year using knives and a power saw, and disposed of his body in plastic bags across several suburbs.

title: US Woman Claims WiFi Router 'Overheating' Set Her Home On Fire
content: Florida resident Keona Huntley said she had been experiencing issues with the WiFi router for some time.
summary: Florida resident Keona Huntley said she had been experiencing issues with the WiFi router for some time.

title: Cash-Strapped Sri Lanka Records Highest Deflation In 61 Years
content: Sri Lanka's consumer prices fell by 2.1 percent in November, the highest deflation rate recorded by the economically fragile island nation since 1961, official data showed Saturday.
summary: Sri Lanka's consumer prices fell by 2.1 percent in November, the highest deflation rate recorded by the economically fragile island nation since 1961, official data showed Saturday.

title: After Hindu Leader's Arrest, 17 ISKCON Bank Accounts Frozen In Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh's authorities have ordered freezing for 30 days the bank accounts of 17 people associated with ISKCON, including its former member Chinmoy Krishna Das arrested this week on sedition charges, media reports said Friday.
summary: Bangladesh's authorities have ordered freezing for 30 days the bank accounts of 17 people associated with ISKCON, including its former member Chinmoy Krishna Das arrested this week on sedition charges, media reports said Friday.

title: UK Woman Fined For Littering In Village She Hadn't Visited For Decades
content: Natalie Walton claimed that she could not have been the accused as she is a non-smoker and has not visited the place where the offence took place.
summary: Natalie Walton claimed that she could not have been the accused as she is a non-smoker and has not visited the place where the offence took place.

title: FBI Issues Urgent Warning For Chrome, Safari And Edge Users
content: The FBI has issued a warning to online shoppers as holiday season scams surge, with an 89% increase in fraudulent websites reported.
summary: The FBI has issued a warning to online shoppers as holiday season scams surge, with an 89% increase in fraudulent websites reported.

title: S Korean Train Conductor's Toilet Break Disrupts Commute For 125 Trains
content: Due to the toilet being on another floor, the train operator took 4 minutes 16 seconds to return to his cabin which led to a domino effect.
summary: Due to the toilet being on another floor, the train operator took 4 minutes 16 seconds to return to his cabin which led to a domino effect.

title: Watch: Man Eats Banana Artwork He Bought For Rs 52 Crore In Auction
content: Mr Sun devoured the pricey banana after giving a speech and calling the artwork, curated by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan "iconic".
summary: Mr Sun devoured the pricey banana after giving a speech and calling the artwork, curated by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan "iconic".

title: Syria's Aleppo Airport Closed As Rebel Group Reaches Heart Of City
content: Syrian authorities closed Aleppo airport and cancelled all flights on Saturday, three military sources told Reuters, as rebels opposed to President Bashar al-Assad said they had reached the heart of the city.
summary: Syrian authorities closed Aleppo airport and cancelled all flights on Saturday, three military sources told Reuters, as rebels opposed to President Bashar al-Assad said they had reached the heart of the city.

title: Canada's Trudeau Arrives In Florida To Meet Trump Amid Tariff Threats
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau arrived in Palm Beach, Florida, on Friday for what Canadian and American media said was a meeting with US President-elect Donald Trump at his Mar-a-Lago luxury estate.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau arrived in Palm Beach, Florida, on Friday for what Canadian and American media said was a meeting with US President-elect Donald Trump at his Mar-a-Lago luxury estate.

title: Hamas Delegation To Hold Gaza Ceasefire Talks Today In Egypt: Official
content: Hamas representatives will go to Cairo on Saturday for talks on a possible ceasefire in Gaza, an official in the Palestinian militant group told AFP on Friday.
summary: Hamas representatives will go to Cairo on Saturday for talks on a possible ceasefire in Gaza, an official in the Palestinian militant group told AFP on Friday.

title: Explained: What Are Bomb Cyclones And How Do They Form?
content: A dangerous weather phenomenon called a bomb cyclone that occurs in mid-latitudes - between Earth's tropics and the polar regions - can bring strong and damaging winds, torrential rains, heavy snowfall, flooding and frigid temperatures.
summary: A dangerous weather phenomenon called a bomb cyclone that occurs in mid-latitudes - between Earth's tropics and the polar regions - can bring strong and damaging winds, torrential rains, heavy snowfall, flooding and frigid temperatures.
